Posts.Content: Georgetta wrote: Have 2 more weeks of Taxol and then I'm done.  Lumpectomy is scheduled for April 22 and then radiation.  I'm planning a trip scuba diving this summer and won't be able to dive with this port in place because of discomfort. At what point did any of you ladies have your port removed.  I can't imagine I'll need it after surgery with clear margins (fingers crossed) and lymph node dissection.  Any thoughts? Hoping for all of you a good week with minimal discomfort. Dx 11/1/2012, IDC, 4cm, ER+ Chemotherapy 11/15/2012 AC Chemotherapy 1/24/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel) Surgery 4/22/2013 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Radiation Therapy 5/7/2013 3DCRT: Breast Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: How long did you keep your port in place? Georgetta Elizabeth1959

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2013 11:25AM Georgetta wrote: Update - Saw my oncologist yesterday.  He is calling my BS to have the port removed when I have my lumpectomy on Apr 22.  My Dr said it was unlikely I would need chemo again ever, but certainly not within the year.  So he agreed that there was no need to keep it in.  Scuba diving here I come.  Yeah!  Thanks for everyone's input.
Posts.Title: How long did you keep your port in place? Georgetta Elizabeth1959
